title: Wire user-provided hero image into Home hero banner and preload

requirements.summary: Add the user-provided hero image as a generated static asset and render it in the Home page hero banner.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero banner image on the Home page renders the user-provided image (no broken image / fallback behavior triggered).
The hero banner image URL returns HTTP 200 in the deployed build and is accessible at a stable path under /assets/generated/.
No console warning appears about the hero image failing to load (i.e., Hero.tsx onError is not triggered under normal load).

file_operations.description: Add the user-provided image content (from image-3.png) as a generated static asset at this exact path so it can be served reliably in production.

Update the hero banner to render /assets/generated/gb-hero-banner.dim_1600x900.png (replacing the current /assets/generated/image-2.png) so the Home page shows the user-provided image and does not trigger the onError fallback under normal load.

requirements.summary: Preload the new hero banner asset in index.html and remove the old hero preload reference.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html preloads the same hero image asset that Hero.tsx renders.
The app no longer references /assets/generated/image-2.png for the hero banner (unless used elsewhere intentionally).

file_operations.description: Replace the current image preload href (/assets/generated/image-2.png) with /assets/generated/gb-hero-banner.dim_1600x900.png so the preloaded asset matches the hero banner image rendered by Hero.tsx.
